channel.title: Where would this go in server.java
channel.description:
[code]controlPanel = new ControlPanel();[/code]
im adding a controlpanel and i can't seem to get this to work look at my compiler [code]server.java:38: <identifier> expected controlPanel = new ControlPanel(); ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
thats what i keep getting am i putting [code]controlPanel = new ControlPanel();[/code] in the wrong place?
please help me

item.title: Where would this go in server.java
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“Vira_, post:17, topic:287870”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=380581.msg2860794#msg2860794 date=1247150964]
You are an idiot.
[/quote]
^

Make the T uncapitalised[/quote]
^

Make the M capital.

Read full topic

item.title: Where would this go in server.java
item.dc:creator: @dantotman dantotman
item.description:
@dantotman wrote:

okay changed it and look what it comes up with now

ControlPanel.java:289: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] You've been giving EXP on your account!"); ^ ControlPanel.java:310: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] You have been giving the command, master!"); ^ ControlPanel.java:327: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] Forced GFX spawned on your account!") ; ^ ControlPanel.java:340: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] Force bank open button pressed on your account!"); ^ ControlPanel.java:351: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] Empty bank button pressed on your account!"); ^ ControlPanel.java:365: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] Forced interface openned on your acco unt!"); ^ ControlPanel.java:382: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] Forced dialogue opened on your account!"); ^ ControlPanel.java:395: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] Forced emote button pressed on your account!"); ^ ControlPanel.java:421: cannot find symbol symbol : variable ToX location: class client c.ToX = X; ^ ControlPanel.java:422: cannot find symbol symbol : variable ToY location: class client c.ToY = Y; ^ ControlPanel.java:423: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[iPanel] Forced teleport button pressed on your account!"); ^ ControlPanel.java:496: cannot find symbol symbol : method sm(java.lang.String) location: class client c.sm("[PM: iPanel]: " + message); ^ Note: EconomyReset.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 12 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 09, 2009, 08:48:29 am[/size][hr]no wait i put sm not sM now look what i have got

ControlPanel.java:421: cannot find symbol symbol : variable ToX location: class client c.ToX = X; ^ ControlPanel.java:422: cannot find symbol symbol : variable ToY location: class client c.ToY = Y; ^ Note: EconomyReset.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Where would this go in server.java
item.dc:creator: @Vira Vira_
item.description:
@Vira wrote:

Open up the ControlPanel.java and press; Ctrl + H in the “Find What” box put

c.sendMessage

Then in the “Replace With” put

c.sM

Then click Replace All.

Read full topic
item.source: Where would this go in server.java

item.title: Where would this go in server.java
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

Most likely, just change sendMessage to sM, teleportToX to toX, and teleportToY to toY.

Read full topic

item.title: Where would this go in server.java
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“Vira_, post:10, topic:287870”][quote author=_ link=topic=380581.msg2860756#msg2860756 date=1247149696]
Make your declaration public. I’m lazy.
public controlPanel controlPanel = new controlPanel();
Help you more?
[/quote]
He wouldn’t need to do that, it would work without the public.[/quote]

Yeah well I woke up 10 minutes ago and was eating waffles when I wrote most of my recent posts. Not thinking too straight. Plus why can’t he just read how the handlers are done?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Vira Vira_
item.description:
@Vira wrote:

Open up your server.java and search for

playerHandler = new PlayerHandler();

Directly underneath put

controlPanel = new ControlPanel();

Save and compile.
